alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Perry; Pulaski; Saline (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 5:28AM CDT until May 11 at 7:10AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 710 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN GARLAND, GRANT, SOUTHERN PERRY, CENTRAL PULASKI, SALINE, EAST CENTRAL CLARK, DALLAS AND EASTERN HOT SPRING COUNTIES... At 528 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Little Rock and surrounding areas could experience very heavy rainfall around the morning commute. Use extra caution if traveling during this heavy rainfall event. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Little Rock, North Little Rock, Benton, West Little Rock, Maumelle, Bryant, Hot Springs Village, Malvern, Downtown Little Rock, Sheridan, Southwest Little Rock, Haskell, Shannon Hills, Wrightsville, Argenta, Rockport, Traskwood, Leola, Tull and Sparkman. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Dallas; Garland; Grant; Hot Spring; Perry; Pulaski; Saline
